body_html:
First, can you send a pull request with these visibility and BUILD changes? There's no reason not to have them. Second, the corrupted attribute name is definitely a sign that something is broken. Can you share a gist or some other way of reproducing this so I can attach a debugger and see what's up? Thanks!
…
On Thu, Aug 17, 2017 at 8:33 PM, Anthony Platanios ***@***.*** > wrote: I have noticed that if I manually set eager op attributes one by one, I get the error whenever I add type attributes. More specifically, I managed to find cases where I get a more complete error message, such as: NodeDef mentions attr 'Ý' not in Op<name=Add; signature=x:T, y:T -> z:T; attr=T:type,allowed=[DT_HALF, DT_FLOAT, DT_DOUBLE, DT_UINT8, DT_INT8, DT_INT16, DT_INT32, DT_INT64, DT_COMPLEX64, DT_COMPLEX128, DT_STRING]>; NodeDef: Add = Add[Ý=DT_FLOAT](). (Check whether your GraphDef-interpreting binary is up to date with your GraphDef-generating binary.). Note that when I set the attribute in the op, the name I use is "T" for the above example. Therefore, something goes wrong, but I cannot figure out what. @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> The only changes I've made to how I compile the TensorFlow dynamic libraries are the following (I had to make them so I could include the eager API in the built dynamic library and use it): 1. In the tensorflow/BUILD file, add "//tensorflow/c/eager:c_api" to the dependencies of the "libtensorflow.so" cc_binary target. 2. In the tensorflow/c/exported_symbols.lds file, add a new line containing: _TFE_*. 3. In the tensorflow/c/eager/BUILD file, change the visibility of the c_api cc_library and the runtime cc_library target to "//visibility:public". — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#12375 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxZzmBMpGfp9CsRa2WkZU3wIgW9uQks5sZQX-gaJpZM4O68WV> .
-- - Alex
body_text:
First, can you send a pull request with these visibility and BUILD changes?
There's no reason not to have them.

Second, the corrupted attribute name is definitely a sign that something is
broken. Can you share a gist or some other way of reproducing this so I can
attach a debugger and see what's up?

Thanks!
…
On Thu, Aug 17, 2017 at 8:33 PM, Anthony Platanios ***@***.*** > wrote:
 I have noticed that if I manually set eager op attributes one by one, I
 get the error whenever I add type attributes. More specifically, I managed
 to find cases where I get a more complete error message, such as:

 NodeDef mentions attr 'Ý' not in Op<name=Add; signature=x:T, y:T -> z:T; attr=T:type,allowed=[DT_HALF, DT_FLOAT, DT_DOUBLE, DT_UINT8, DT_INT8, DT_INT16, DT_INT32, DT_INT64, DT_COMPLEX64, DT_COMPLEX128, DT_STRING]>; NodeDef: Add = Add[Ý=DT_FLOAT](). (Check whether your GraphDef-interpreting binary is up to date with your GraphDef-generating binary.).

 Note that when I set the attribute in the op, the name I use is "T" for
 the above example. Therefore, something goes wrong, but I cannot figure out
 what.

 @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> The only changes I've made to how I
 compile the TensorFlow dynamic libraries are the following (I had to make
 them so I could include the eager API in the built dynamic library and use
 it):

    1. In the tensorflow/BUILD file, add "//tensorflow/c/eager:c_api"
    to the dependencies of the "libtensorflow.so" cc_binary
    target.
    2. In the tensorflow/c/exported_symbols.lds file, add a new line
    containing: _TFE_*.
    3. In the tensorflow/c/eager/BUILD file, change the visibility of
    the c_api cc_library and the runtime cc_library target to
    "//visibility:public".

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#12375 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxZzmBMpGfp9CsRa2WkZU3wIgW9uQks5sZQX-gaJpZM4O68WV>
 .


-- 
 - Alex
body:
First, can you send a pull request with these visibility and BUILD changes?
There's no reason not to have them.

Second, the corrupted attribute name is definitely a sign that something is
broken. Can you share a gist or some other way of reproducing this so I can
attach a debugger and see what's up?

Thanks!

On Thu, Aug 17, 2017 at 8:33 PM, Anthony Platanios <notifications@github.com
> wrote:

> I have noticed that if I manually set eager op attributes one by one, I
> get the error whenever I add type attributes. More specifically, I managed
> to find cases where I get a more complete error message, such as:
>
> NodeDef mentions attr 'Ý' not in Op<name=Add; signature=x:T, y:T -> z:T; attr=T:type,allowed=[DT_HALF, DT_FLOAT, DT_DOUBLE, DT_UINT8, DT_INT8, DT_INT16, DT_INT32, DT_INT64, DT_COMPLEX64, DT_COMPLEX128, DT_STRING]>; NodeDef: Add = Add[Ý=DT_FLOAT](). (Check whether your GraphDef-interpreting binary is up to date with your GraphDef-generating binary.).
>
> Note that when I set the attribute in the op, the name I use is "T" for
> the above example. Therefore, something goes wrong, but I cannot figure out
> what.
>
> @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> The only changes I've made to how I
> compile the TensorFlow dynamic libraries are the following (I had to make
> them so I could include the eager API in the built dynamic library and use
> it):
>
>    1. In the tensorflow/BUILD file, add "//tensorflow/c/eager:c_api"
>    to the dependencies of the "libtensorflow.so" cc_binary
>    target.
>    2. In the tensorflow/c/exported_symbols.lds file, add a new line
>    containing: _TFE_*.
>    3. In the tensorflow/c/eager/BUILD file, change the visibility of
>    the c_api cc_library and the runtime cc_library target to
>    "//visibility:public".
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/12375#issuecomment-323250120>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxZzmBMpGfp9CsRa2WkZU3wIgW9uQks5sZQX-gaJpZM4O68WV>
> .
>



-- 
 - Alex
